founding_conditions.starting_capital: $500K-$1M, can raise more if opportunity merits
founding_conditions.founder_1: operator, Argentina citizen, US resident, English+Spanish
founding_conditions.founder_2: ML/AI Masters Georgia Tech, US citizen
founding_conditions.operating_geo: US+LATAM lowest friction, any geo if economics justify overhead
founding_conditions.credentials: no CPA/JD/MD — willing to acquire licensed businesses
founding_conditions.languages: English+Spanish native, others = cost adder not blocker
founding_conditions.optimization_target: opportunity quality + VC differentiation, NOT capital fit

history.reason: Post Cycle 3: themes established, need depth over novelty. Boost data specificity for unit economics verification. Boost cross-signal reinforcement to detect convergences.

Post Cycle 6 counter-signal revolution: added counter_signal_severity (1.5) because counter-evidence was decisive in 3/3 verifications — must be weighted heavily to prevent confirmation bias. Added competitive_density (1.3) because competitive landscape was the blind spot that inflated Opp 1 and Opp 3 scores. Both are now permanent grading dimensions.

running_patterns.description: P2+P5 Divergence Corridor: Professional services in liquidation cascade while healthcare faces permanent labor shortage
running_patterns.cycle_6_note: Pattern confirmed but entry window for prof services is crowded (147 PE deals, $500M+ Crete). Healthcare side blocked by regulation. Pattern itself is validated — actionable entry points require less crowded sectors.

running_patterns.description: P2+P3 Credit-Squeeze Accelerator: Falling credit availability preventing incumbent restructuring while AI entrants need minimal capital
running_patterns.cycle_6_note: Promoted from emerging to confirmed. Credit squeeze continues to accelerate distress among incumbents who cannot self-fund AI transformation. The squeeze is real — but PE firms are filling the capital gap for some sectors (professional services). Need to find sectors where the credit squeeze operates WITHOUT PE intervention.

running_patterns.description: P1+P3 Cost Floor Unlock: 1000x inference cost collapse enabling new tier of agentic businesses
running_patterns.cycle_6_note: Consistently the strongest macro signal. Every cost reduction opens new business tiers. The 320% spending surge confirms Kondratieff deployment phase. This pattern is sector-agnostic and continues to create opportunities.

running_patterns.description: P7 Timing Arbitrage: Companies cutting human capacity before AI can deliver, creating service vacuums
running_patterns.cycle_6_note: PROMOTED from emerging to confirmed. HBR data validates the mechanism. JOLTS decline (-966K, -12.9%) supports broad labor market cooling driven partly by premature AI-motivated cuts. HIGH PRIORITY for Cycle 7: identify specific sectors with the widest human-cut-to-AI-readiness gap.

running_patterns.description: PE Roll-Up Vulnerability: PE firms deploying $200B+ into fragmented sector roll-ups may face Minsky distress as AI disruption outpaces their restructuring capacity
running_patterns.cycle_6_note: NEW pattern identified from counter-signal research. The same competitive density that killed our entry thesis creates a second-order opportunity: PE roll-ups are leveraged, assume stable client retention (contradicted by 20-25% attrition data), and may face Minsky distress if AI disruption accelerates. H2-H3 timing.

killed: Healthcare Staffing AI (K-001: nurse ratio manipulation illegal)
Agentic Back-Office for SMBs (K-002: Intuit moat + Bench/Pilot failure precedent)
parked: Distressed Professional Services Acquisition (competitive landscape saturated — $500M+ Crete, 147 PE deals)

agent_a.kill_index_hit_rate: 10.7% (3/28 signals matched K-001 or K-002 patterns)
agent_a.notes: Cycle 6 added counter-signal research as a new source category. Agent A produced 9 critical counter-signals that drove 2 kills and 1 park. Counter-signal production is now a core Agent A function, not an add-on.

agent_b.pursue_rate: 0% (0 PURSUE, 2 INVESTIGATE_FURTHER retained from Cycle 3, 1 PARK, 2 KILL)
common_kill_reasons: Regulatory prohibition of core value proposition
Incumbent moat + proven startup failure pattern
agent_b.notes: Cycle 6 was Agent B's highest-impact cycle. Counter-signal research gave B real ammunition. The kill rate increased from 0% to 67% (2/3 top opportunities) reflecting genuine verification rigor, not pessimism. B's theoretical checks (Schumpeter timing, Minsky reversal) proved operationally decisive.

key_unknowns: Which sectors show P2 cascade dynamics (declining employment + rising bankruptcies) but have NOT attracted >$100M in PE/VC capital?
Are the same professional services cascade dynamics occurring in Argentina/Brazil with less PE competition?
Which specific sectors have the widest gap between human layoffs (P7 timing arbitrage) and AI delivery readiness?
Is the Construction AI Coordinator space free of well-funded competitors, or will counter-signal research reveal the same crowding issue?
Are the 147 PE accounting roll-ups showing any early signs of Minsky distress (client attrition, integration cost overruns, revenue shortfalls)?
What is the competitive landscape for veterinary services, translation, property management, insurance brokerage, and freight brokerage AI solutions?
Does the Principles Engine work equally well for identifying opportunities in sectors we have no prior thesis about (pure discovery mode)?
What specific regulatory barriers exist for the candidate sectors (veterinary, insurance, freight) — are any sectors protected like healthcare?
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Run competitive density scans on Construction AI Coordinator and 5-7 new candidate sectors (veterinary, translation, property management, insurance brokerage, freight brokerage, surveying). Apply mandatory counter-signal research BEFORE scoring above 60.

PRIORITY 2: Deep-dive P7 Timing Arbitrage — use BLS sector-level employment data + JOLTS by industry to identify sectors with largest human-cut-to-AI-readiness gap. These vacuums are the highest-value scanning targets.

PRIORITY 3: Add LATAM data sources to Agent A. Scan Argentina/Brazil professional services for cascade dynamics. Founder 1 has direct operating access — this is a unique competitive advantage if LATAM cascades exist without PE competition.

PRIORITY 4: Apply the Principles Engine to at least 2 sectors with ZERO prior thesis (pure discovery mode). Test whether the framework identifies opportunities we would not have found through directed scanning.
PROCESS: For any opportunity scoring above 60, MANDATORY counter-signal research before advancing to verification. This is the Cycle 6 lesson codified as process.
PROCESS: Add competitive_density (1.3) and counter_signal_severity (1.5) as permanent grading weights in Agent C.

MONITOR: Set quarterly trigger to check PE roll-up health — Crete, Ascend, Accrual, and the broader 147-deal accounting PE landscape. Early Minsky distress signals = reactivation trigger for parked Prof Services opportunity.
MONITOR: Track H.R. 3415 / S. 1709 legislative status quarterly. If both die in committee AND NNU campaign weakens, K-001 invalidation conditions partially met.
